column4: guys, how to get my freenode nick dropped if I forgot my password?
it's 90 days you have to wait
how do I do to apply them
is there a howto about that?
yes there is many howto's on how to do that
I already have a previous kernel showing up in GRUB so I can take my chances
well if you save the kernel you make as the same name of the kernel already there it will overwrite that kernel that you have already made
I mean from the update service
yes but if you name the kernel that you compile as the same name of the kernel you havr now that kernel you have now will be gone
but here is the wiki entry https://wiki.ubuntu.com/KernelCustomBuild?highlight=%28kernel%29
I would be carful with that
Is there a way to check the config of my current kernel?
well if you get the kernel source it will probably have the same config, but you can check /boot for a .config file
thanks on the pointers, let me get to work on it
would it be a safer route to file a bug in Launchpad?
